lead_paragraph: Advisers and family members stressed to Mr. Trump that he was selecting a running mate to unite the party, not a new best friend, according to people briefed on the process.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Dirk Johnson, Jonathan Martin, Nate Schweber and Thomas Kaplan.
byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and MAGGIE HABERMAN

headline.print_headline: Anger, Doubt and Finally a Selection: How Trump Made His Choice of No. 2
headline.main: How Donald Trump Finally Settled on Mike Pence

snippet: Advisers and family members stressed to Mr. Trump that he was selecting a running mate to unite the party, not a new best friend, according to people briefed on the process....
abstract: Donald Trump's choice of Indiana Gov Mike Pence as running mate was came after tense deliberations in which aides and family members often reminded Trump that pick had to united Republican Party; while Pence is viewed as safe bet by Republican establishment, choice is bit of risk for Trump, who usually chooses allies based on loyalty.
